In this state, you are left with two options: either <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>return<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> immediately to your current <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>home point<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or wait for another PC to revive you using an action or spell such as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Raise<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. When in an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>instanced dungeon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, you will return to the area entrance.

In addition to rendering you temporarily <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>weakened<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> after being raised, suffering a KO also severely damages your currently equipped gear. When a piece of equipment's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>durability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> reaches 0%, its stats drop significantly, so do not forget to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>repair<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> your gear regularly.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※ Gear damage through KO is only experienced if you have reached level 10.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※ KO in certain special duties will also not result in gear damage.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Instanced raids come with several rules─including time limits and restrictions on changing classes or jobs. Instanced areas can be left at any time by using an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>exit<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Leave<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Finder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, but by doing so, remember that you will be abandoning your party in the process. Exits will also appear after defeating a raid boss, allowing your party easy access out of the area without having to backtrack.

Once a boss has been engaged, players will be unable to enter or leave the immediate area. Make sure that all your party members are nearby and prepared beforehand, lest you incur their undying wrath.

If you are KO'd during an instanced raid, you may either have a party member <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Raise<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> you, or choose to return to the instance entrance.

Your main weapon determines your current class. Changing classes is as easy as equipping a different type of weapon or tool to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Main Hand<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> slot.

When playing more than one class or job, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gear sets<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> allow you to save several different combinations of equipment and swap them at your leisure. A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> window.
You now have access to the Armoury system. Quests to unlock other classes can be undertaken by speaking to the receptionist in the corresponding guild.

It should be noted that, in addition to martial classes, you may also choose to become a Disciple of the Hand─one who synthesizes items from on hand materials─or a Disciple of the Land─one who harvests resources from the field.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Mastering more than one class is the first step to becoming a well-rounded adventurer.

You are about to enter a special instance. These areas are reserved for important battles which feature unique environmental conditions or powerful boss enemies. Instance objectives can be confirmed in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

For the duration of the battle, you will be unable to pass beyond the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>red line<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> displayed on the field.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You will automatically leave the instance once all quest objectives have been met.

Important quests used to tell the story of Eorzea and her people are called <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main scenario quests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. These tasks are easily distinguishable from others by their unique <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Quests using this icon indicate a task or series of tasks are tied to new duties or features you have yet to unlock.

There are some <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> which only can be learned by completing specific <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>class quests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. For example, the ranged lancer weaponskill <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Piercing Talon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is acquired by completing the Lancers' Guild quest available at level 15.

A myriad of items can be bought and sold from vendors all across Eorzea. Purchasing an item is as simple as clicking on an item in a shopkeep's inventory, while selling an item is as simple as dragging an item from your inventory or Armoury Chest. You can also sell items by right-clicking them and selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Sell<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

If you happen to have second thoughts about a sale, you can always <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>buy back<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> your item from the vendor, but only if you have yet to leave the area or log out of the game.

A myriad of items can be bought and sold from vendors all across Eorzea. Purchasing an item is as simple as selecting an item from a shopkeep's inventory, while selling an item is as simple as selecting an item from your inventory or Armoury Chest and choosing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Sell<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the subcommand menu.

Right-click on a target to switch to active mode and ready auto-attack. Approach and face the target to start the battle. Two rotating <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>arrows<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will appear over the target you are currently attacking.

Various actions such as spells and weaponskills can be performed by clicking the icons located in the<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> on the bottom of your screen. These actions can also be initiated using the shortcut keys indicated in the upper left-hand corner of each icon.

Most actions require magic points (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>MP<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) to execute, in addition to having recast times of various lengths. Detailed information on an action can be viewed by mousing over its icon.

Disciples of Magic and Disciples of War who specialize in ranged attacks (such as archers) are best suited fighting their targets from a distance. The range and radius of an action can also be confirmed in the help window.

Since the Armoury system in FINAL FANTASY XIV allows you to change your class or job by simply changing the weapon or tool in your main hand, it is recommended that you always have several sets of gear on hand. However, gear can take up a tremendous amount of space in one's inventory, which is why all adventurers carry an <hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>Armoury Chest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

All gear purchased, crafted, or found is automatically stored in this chest, leaving your inventory free to fill with other items such as potions, crafting materials, and food.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Gear in your Armoury Chest is categorized and sorted by type, and can be equipped or discarded directly from the chest interface.

The Armoury Chest can be accessed at any time by selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the main menu followed by <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Armoury Chest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, or pressing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ctrl+I<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

A crescent moon icon will appear to the right of your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>experience bar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> whenever you enter a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sanctuary<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Limit breaks are powerful actions which are only available to parties of four or more members. The actions can be executed when the party's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>limit gauge<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is full. The gauge is located directly above the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>party list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

The limit gauge will slowly fill as battle progresses, while certain acts of heroism─such as curing an ally while they are on the brink of death, or preventing an enemy from using its special attack─will cause the gauge to rise quicker.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Limit Break<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> trigger is located in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> menu under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>General<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. It can be set to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for easy access.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>There are five different types of limit breaks: single-target attack (melee), attack to all targets in a straight line (ranged), area of effect attack (caster), increase party defense (tank), and HP restoration (healer). Which type is used depends on the class/job of the person who initiates the action.
Limit gauge length varies depending on party size and battle type. The more party members you have, and the more difficult the foe you face, the more options you will have.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Level sync<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a system which allows players to participate in lower level duties by temporarily adjusting their levels, and is available for most FATEs and instanced raids.

When your level is synced, not only your personal attributes, but the attributes of your gear will automatically be lowered to meet the requirements set by the duty in which you are participating. Once the duty ends, everything is restored to its original state.
Experience earned while level synced is based off the synced level, not your current level; however, it will be added to the progress of the latter.

When your chocobo acquires his first skill from any of these trees, he will also learn that tree's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>stance<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

How you choose to use your chocobo's skill points is entirely up to you, but remember─once an action or trait has been purchased, that purchase cannot be undone. Think about how you wish to use your chocobo in battle and choose its path of progression wisely.

To bolster their strength, the Grand Companies of Eorzea seek donations of rare items. Accepted items are those which are <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sellable<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and whose names are <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>not yellow<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in their help window. <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Aetherial gear<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is an example of such.

If you wish to make a donation, speak to a Grand Company <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>quartermaster<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to complete the delivery. You will be rewarded company seals for your contribution.

Free companies are independent player-operated organizations, not unlike guilds. While there are no restrictions on who may join a company, players cannot belong to more than one free company at a time.

Companies will advance in rank as their members earn <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>company points<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> by undertaking various duties around Eorzea. These tasks will also earn companies <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>credits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which can be used as currency to purchase various items.
To form a company, a player must first draft a petition and then get three other players to sign it. These three players will become the founding members of the company.

You have been asked to sign a free company petition. To form a new free company, a player must first obtain the signatures of three other people who agree to become the founding members of the company. If you wish to join, sign the petition!
You have joined a free company! Start by changing your chat mode to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Free Company<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and greeting the other members.

Selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Free Company<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Social<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> section of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will display the Free Company interface. Here you can view company and member data, messages, and other important information.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Each member is assigned a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rank<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, each with various levels of <hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>authorization<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Depending on your rank, you may or may not be able to access such features as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>promoting<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> current members or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>inviting<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> new players.

As company members participate in various duties around Eorzea, they will not only earn experience points for themselves, but points for their free company as well. As company points are earned, the free company will increase in rank. As rank increases, new features such as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>company crests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, an expanded <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>company chest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>housing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> become available.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>company chest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a communal depository where free company members can store their excess gear and items. It can be accessed not only from the company's estate, but from Grand Company headquarters, and other convenient locations. Access rights are set by company leaders and can range from full access to all members to restricted access for a select few.

As the company increases in rank, additional compartments will be added to the chest, increasing the number of items which can be stored within.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Remember, unlike your personal inventory, the company chest is shared. To avoid misunderstandings with fellow company members, refrain from using the chest to store important personal effects.

Your free company can now create its own unique <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>company crest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. To edit the company crest you must first have <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>authorization<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to do so. Next, you must speak with an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>OIC officer of arms<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> located at one of the three Grand Company of Eorzea headquarters.

Once your company has attained the proper rank, you will have the opportunity to apply the crest to pieces of armor for all the realm to see. Be advised, however, that company crests cannot be applied to certain armor. This can be confirmed via the item's help window.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Company Actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can be used to temporarily increase the statuses of all online company members. They can be accessed under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Free Company<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> interface.

Actions can be purchased from <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>OIC quartermasters<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> with <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>company credits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The higher your company's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>standing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> with its Grand Company of allegiance, the fewer credits the actions will require.
To purchase, execute, disable, or discard actions, you must first have been granted the proper company <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>authorization<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to do so.

Speaking with a local distributor of guildleves, known as a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>levemete<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, will bring up a list of available levequests. Highlight a quest to display its objectives, and select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Accept<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to add the quest to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>journal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Leve allowances<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are required to accept levequests. You will be granted three leve allowances every 12 hours (Earth time), up to a maximum of 100.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You may accept as many as 16 levequests at once.

To initiate a levequest, first open your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>journal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> section of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, or by pressing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>J<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> on your keyboard. Next, select the levequest to bring up a detailed description of its objectives and its rewards.

Clicking on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Map<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button will show the approximate location of the levequest's objectives. Though you can initiate a levequest at any time while in the corresponding area, it is recommended that you wait until you are close to the objectives before doing so. This will increase your chances of becoming eligible for completion bonuses.
Once you have arrived, open the journal, select the levequest, and click on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Initiate<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button to begin your duty.

To initiate a levequest, first open your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>journal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> section of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Next, select the levequest to bring up a detailed description of its objectives and its rewards.

Selecting the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Map<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button will show the approximate location of the levequest's objectives. Though you can initiate a levequest at any time while in the corresponding area, it is recommended that you wait until you are close to the objectives before doing so. This will increase your chances of becoming eligible for completion bonuses.
Once you have arrived, open the journal, select the levequest, and press the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Initiate<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button to begin your duty.

When you initiate a levequest, you will be given the opportunity to adjust its difficulty. The greater the difficulty setting, the higher the level target enemies will be. Difficulty also affects completion rewards.

Levequest difficulty can be lowered at any time during the course of the duty by selecting the quest name in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Difficulty<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Please note that levequest difficulty cannot be raised once the duty has been initiated.

Once you have initiated a levequest, the location of your quest objectives will be displayed on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Levequest targets can also be identified by the distinguishing icon displayed above their names.

During a levequest, the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is replaced with information regarding quest objectives, leve difficulty, time remaining, and more. Rewards are only granted to those who complete all the objectives listed within the time allotted.

When all levequest objectives have been completed, you will be given the option to return immediately to the issuing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>levemete<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and collect your reward.

If you fail to complete the levequest objectives within the allotted time, you can always rechallenge the quest by selecting it in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>journal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and pressing the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Retry<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button. Rechallenging a levequest will cost one <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>leve allowance<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

If you fail to complete the levequest objectives within the allotted time, you can always rechallenge the quest by selecting it in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>journal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and pressing the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Retry<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button. Rechallenging a levequest will cost one <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>leve allowance<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Tradecraft<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> leves (guildleves for Disciples of the Hand) are governed by a different set of rules than their <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>battlecraft<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> counterparts (guildleves for Disciples of War and Magic). For example, tradecraft leves have no time limit, and are considered complete when the items requested have been delivered to the client. Information on leve objectives as well as the client's name can be viewed in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

After assembing all the requested items, speak with the client to bring up the Item Request window. Drag the items from your inventory into the Item Request window and click <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Hand Over<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to complete the transaction. For tradecraft leves, submitting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>HQ<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items will earn you a greater reward.

After assembling all the requested items, speak with the client to bring up the Item Request window. Select the items from your inventory to add them to the Item Request window and select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Hand Over<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to complete the transaction. For tradecraft leves, submitting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>HQ<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items will earn you a greater reward.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Fieldcraft<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> leves (guildleves for Disciples of the Land) follow the same set of rules as their <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>battlecraft<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> counterparts (guildleves for Disciples of War and Magic). There are, however, two main differences: you cannot begin a fieldcraft levequest unless you have changed to the corresponding class, and you must perform these tasks solo.

Leves for <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Fishers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, on the other hand, follow the same set of rules as tradecraft leves, in that you will be required to deliver your catch to the client in person. Selecting the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Map<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button will show the approximate location of the desired catch. After obtaining all the requested items, speak with the client to hand them over and collect your reward.

Once a leve has been initiated, its objectives will appear in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Fieldcraft leve objectives range from visiting specified locations to gathering the specified number of items, all within the allotted time limit.

After gathering the specified items at the required level, certain levequests will grant bonus rewards depending on your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>evaluation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> score.<hex:02100103>Levequest targets are indicated with a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>leve plate icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> displayed above their <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>display names<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The general location of targets is also marked on your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
If you possess the same guildleve as the one activated by your party, a leve link will occur, ensuring that you receive full recompense upon completing the quest.

FATE is short for <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Full Active Time Event<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. These public quests occur periodically in real time around Eorzea, and anyone can participate by simply showing up before one ends. When you sense a FATE nearby, a message will appear on your screen, and the location will be displayed on your maps.
The type of FATE in progress can be identified by its map icon. Mousing over the icon will display the FATE title.

You will automatically join a FATE the moment you cross the event threshold. At this time, the FATE title, objectives, and time remaining will appear in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

If you are several levels higher than the recommended level, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Level Sync<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button will appear in your duty list. Press the button to automatically lower your level so that you may participate and receive rewards.
Once a FATE is complete, a window detailing your reward will be displayed. Rewards are distributed to all event participants and are based not only on success, but on individual contributions.

The more active you are in completing event objectives, the greater your contribution will be deemed. Contribution is indicated via the gold, silver, or bronze medal that appears on your reward window.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Guildhests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are special operations organized by Adventurers' Guilds and overseen by NPCs known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>battlewardens<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Speaking with a battlewarden displays a list of all guildhests currently available. Please note, however, that each operation has conditions (such as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>level<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>class<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) that must be met by all party members before the duty can be commenced.

At first, you may find that only a limited number of guildhests are accessible, but do not worry. As you progress in level, that number will grow.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Guildhests can also be accessed via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Finder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, removing the hassle of having to try and gather a party.

Once you have commenced a guildhest, the operation's objectives and the time remaining to complete them will appear in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>duty list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Hints helpful to completing guildhest objectives will sometimes appear on-screen. These hints will also be added to the duty list after being displayed.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If you are unable to complete the objectives within the allotted time, the guildhest will be deemed a failure.

While participating in guildhests, you may notice areas that are colored differently than the surrounding landscape. This color is to warn players that stepping into the hazardous zones will trigger new enemies to appear. Take care when passing nearby.

If you are KO'd while participating in a guildhest, you will be given the option to return to the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>starting point of the operation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, rather than all the way back to your home point.

If you successfully complete all guildhest objectives in the time allotted, you will be eligible for a reward. Speak with the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>battlewarden<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> overseeing the operation to collect it. If your party can complete the objectives without suffering a single casualty, you will be rewarded a special bonus.

You are now able to change your Grand Company of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>allegiance<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. To proceed with the necessary paperwork, speak with a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>personnel officer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> at any of the Grand Company headquarters.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Do note that upon changing allegiances, all assets (company seals) will be frozen, and some items, such as company-specific gear, may no longer be equippable. Furthermore, there is a cooling-off period of 15 days during which time you will be unable to apply for another transfer.

You can now craft items using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Quick Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Quick synthesis is available for any item you have successfully crafted at least once using traditional methods, and can significantly reduce the amount of time required to create multiple normal-quality items.

To begin quick synthesis, open your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>crafting log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, select the desired recipe, and then press the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Quick Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button to the immediate left of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Synthesize<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button.
As quick synthesis only focuses on completing the recipe as fast as possible, it is difficult to produce high-quality items. If quality is your aim, normal synthesis is recommended.

All Disciples of the Hand receive a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>crafting log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> which contains the recipes of every item they can synthesize. The crafting log can be opened by selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Logs<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
To begin synthesis, you must first select the crafting class and level tier of the item you wish to create.

Once you have highlighted the item, confirm if you possess all the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>materials<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> necessary in your inventory. If you do, select the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Synthesize<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button to begin the crafting process.
Crafting is similar to battle in that various <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are used to proceed.

Successfully crafting an item entails executing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> actions to achieve 100% <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>progress<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> before material <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>durability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> reaches zero.
If durability reaches zero before progress has reached 100%, the synthesis will fail and some of the materials may be lost.
Items that you have successfully crafted at least once will appear with a check mark on their icons. Crafting an item for the first time will earn you a special experience point bonus.
Crafting is similar to battle in that various <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are used to proceed.

Increasing an item's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>quality<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> during synthesis improves chances that the resulting product will be of a higher grade (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>HQ<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>).

Quality is normally improved by using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Touch<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> actions. However, in addition to reducing material durability, these actions also require crafting points (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>CP<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) to execute.
The higher the overall quality of a completed item, the higher the experience point reward will be.

Quality is normally improved by using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Touch<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> actions. However, in addition to reducing material durability, these actions also require crafting points (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>CP<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) to execute.
As synthesis progresses, material <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>condition<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will fluctuate between excellent and poor.

Using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Touch<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> actions when condition is either <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>good<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>excellent<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will result in greater increases in quality when the action is successful. Note, however, that in the following step, material condition will always drop to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>poor<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Every time you use an action, receive damage, or suffer a KO, the gear you have equipped is damaged. When your gear's condition reaches 0%, its functionality drops off severely.

Gear condition can be viewed by selecting Character under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The vertical bar situated next to each gear icon indicates approximate condition. An exact percentage can be viewed in the item help text by mousing over the icon.

NPCs conducting item repairs are indicated on your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>map<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> by a hammer icon. For a small fee, they will restore an item's condition to 100%.
Disciples of the Hand have the ability to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>repair<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> their own items. To begin mending an item, select its icon and choose Repair.

Each item has class and level restrictions on who can repair it. This information can be viewed in an item's help text. In addition to meeting these restrictions, Disciples of the Hand must also use the proper grade of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>dark matter<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to complete the repairs. Dark matter can be purchased from Grand Company quartermasters.

You have obtained a high-quality item! HQ items can be identified by their icon, as well as by the special mark that appears after their name.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>HQ<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> gear will often have better stats than normal-quality items, while HQ materials used in synthesis will sometimes yield better results. These features make them more attractive to prospective buyers, resulting in higher selling prices.
HQ items cannot be stacked with normal-quality items.

You have obtained a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>unique<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> item.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>As this item is special, you can never possess more than one at a time.
An item you have equipped is now <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>bound<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to you and can no longer be traded or put up for sale in the markets.

Most items can be sold and traded freely before they are used in battle, crafting, or gathering. This is true regardless of whether or not they have been equipped. However, performing one of these three actions after equipping a new piece of gear will bind the item to you, preventing future trade or sale to other players (NPC shops will still purchase bound items).

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>markets<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are a venue in which players from across the realm can either sell their own items using hired hands known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>retainers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or purchase the items of another. The markets can be accessed by targeting and selecting one of the many <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>market boards<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> conveniently located throughout Eorzea's towns and city–states.

The markets of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, Ul'dah, Ishgard, Kugane, and the Crystarium are all connected, meaning that items put up for sale in one city–state can be viewed as well as purchased by players accessing the markets in a second city–state.

Sifting through the sheer number of items up for sale in the markets can prove an overwhelming task for those not familiar with the system. As most gear required for the first few levels of any class can be easily found at local NPC-run shops, it is recommended that players start here, and then work their way to the markets once they feel those shops can no longer meet their needs.

Before you can purchase an item from the markets, you must first find it. There are two different ways you can do this─one involves doing a direct search by typing in the name of the item you seek. The second consists of specifying search conditions to bring up a list of corresponding items.

If you know the exact name of the item you seek, then you need only type it in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Free Search<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> box and then press the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Search<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button located in the lower left-hand corner of the window. Typing an incomplete entry will bring up all items that begin with those letters. For example, typing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Boarskin Cr<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will display both Boarskin Crakows and Boarskin Crakows of Gathering.

If you would rather list all items that fall under a certain category, start by specifying search conditions from <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Main Arm<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Armor<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Items<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> located under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Category Search<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. For example, if you wanted to view all footwear equippable by level 35 archers, you would first click on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Feet<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> icon under Armor, set the level indicator to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>35<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and then finally click the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Search <hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button.
If there are any matches to your search, they will be displayed in the window to the right. The number to the right of the name indicates how many of the item are available for purchase.
If an item in the search list is available for purchase, you can select the icon to bring up a second list indicating the item's selling prices, ordered from lowest to highest.

Select the item you wish to buy to display a final prompt from which you can confirm or cancel the transaction.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Please note that you will be charged a transaction fee when completing a purchase.

If you have a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>retainer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in your employ, you can have them place items up for sale in the markets. A <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>5%<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> tax is charged to every sale.

To put an item up for sale, you must first entrust it to your retainer. Next, select the item from their inventory and decide upon a selling price. The number listed in the list represents the buying price offered by NPCs.

Items that are <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>untradable<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>bound<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to you cannot be sold to other players, therefore you will be unable to move them from your retainer's inventory to the Market window.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Summoning bells<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are used to call forth any retainers you have in your employ. Retainers are helpful NPCs who can be hired by players to maintain items and gil, as well as place goods up for sale in the markets.

Once you have been given approval to hire retainers, speak with <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Frydwyb<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Limsa Lominsa, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Parnell<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Gridania, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Chachabi<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Ul'dah, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Prunilla<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Ishgard, or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Kazashi<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Kugane.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Retainers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are helpful NPCs who can be hired by players to carry out such tasks as storing excess gil and gear, or selling unwanted items on the markets. They may also be sent afield on <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ventures<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

A contract of service can be drafted by <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Frydwyb<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Limsa Lominsa, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Parnell<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Gridania, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Chachabi<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Ul'dah, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Prunilla<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Ishgard, or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Kazashi<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Kugane.

Once a retainer is summoned, you can entrust them with gil or items, as well as have them put entrusted items up for sale in the markets. Additionally, you can also send them afield on <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ventures<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

To entrust an item to or retrieve an item from your retainer, simply drag it from one inventory window to the other. To transfer gil, click on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gil Transfer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button to open a separate window.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>To entrust stackable items that are identical to those already possessed by your retainer, select the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Entrust Duplicates<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button.
Some gathering points will possess certain characteristics that, when exploited, may increase overall yield, or number of gathering attempts.

Gathering point characteristics are displayed directly beneath a point's integrity bar, but only can be seen after acquiring one of the Disciple of the Land <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Whisperer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> traits.

The higher your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>perception<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating, the better chance you have of obtaining high-quality (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>HQ<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) items while gathering.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>(Some items do not have an HQ counterpart.)

You can use the Disciple of the Land action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Preparation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to confirm how high your perception rating must be before you are able to obtain HQ items. The percentage displayed in the gathering interface indicates your chance of success.

Using certain actions or meeting certain attribute conditions can increase your chances of finding HQ items, but only if your perception rating is sufficient enough to obtain HQ items in the first place.

Botanists can use hatchets and other cutting tools to log the forests of Eorzea and gather materials for use in crafting. Trees that are prime for logging are known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mature trees<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Mature trees are only discernible from other foliage when using the action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Triangulate<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. While this action is active, the location of mature trees is displayed on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Once you have arrived at a mature tree, right-click it to begin logging.

Mature trees are only discernible from other foliage when using the action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Triangulate<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. While this action is active, the location of mature trees is displayed on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Once you have arrived at a mature tree, target and select it to begin logging.
As many as eight different types of items can be found on a single gathering point. Begin gathering by selecting an item from the list that appears after right-clicking the target.

Your chances of successfully obtaining the selected item are displayed as a percentage to the right of its icon. Gear with a high <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gathering<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating will improve these chances, but only if your class level is at or above the item level (also displayed to the right of the item icon).

An item's position on the list is determined by its type. For example, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>branches<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are always found in the third slot. Remembering which type of items are located in which slots will help you when coming across a new type of mature tree.

A list of items available through gathering can be viewed by opening the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gathering log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. This feature is accessible via <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Logs<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Items that you have successfully gathered at least once will appear with a check mark on their icons. Gathering an item for the first time will earn you a special experience point bonus.
Certain items can only be obtained in certain areas. To confirm where an item might be found, refer to your gathering log.

The Disciple of the Land action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Sneak<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> allows you to conceal yourself from enemies so that you may log, mine, or fish without fear of being attacked. Be mindful, however, that this ability is not effective against enemies with a level significantly higher than your own.

The one drawback to this command is that it reduces movement speed by almost half, so when there are no threats nearby, it is recommended that you cancel the status by selecting the Stealth icon on your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> once again.

Stealth cannot be used if you are being attacked by an enemy. Also, enemies with levels significantly higher than yours may be able to detect you, regardless of whether or not you have Stealth activated.

The Disciple of the Land action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Stealth<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> allows you to conceal yourself from enemies so that you may log, mine, or fish without fear of being attacked.

In addition to logging, botanists can use secondary tools to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>harvest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items from patches of foliage referred to as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>lush vegetation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. As is the case with mature trees, these locations are only discernible when using the action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Triangulate<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

To harvest, you must first equip a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>scythe<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>off hand<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Scythes can be obtained from shops, markets, or quests.

You have obtained a whistle with which you can summon your very own minion! To learn the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Call Minion<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> action, you must first <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Use<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> the whistle.

Once you have used the item, a new entry will appear in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Minion Guide<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. You can either initiate the action from this menu, or drag the icon, set it to one of your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hotbars<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and initiate it from there.

To send your minion away, simply re-select the summoning icon.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Minions can be summoned or dismissed at any time, and the whistle has no recast timer. Once you have learned the summoning action, you will never lose it, and it can be used with all classes or jobs. You can only summon one minion at a time.
While minions do not generate any enmity, neither will they participate in battle. If you are KO'd, your minion will simply wander off back to wherever it is it rests until you call upon it again.

Once you have used the item, a new entry will appear in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Minion Guide<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu. You can either initiate the action from this menu, or set it to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>cross hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and initiate it from there.

To send your minion away, simply re-select the summoning icon.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Minions can be summoned or dismissed at any time, and the whistle has no recast timer. Once you have learned the summoning action, you will never lose it, and it can be used with all classes or jobs. You can only summon one minion at a time.

You are now able to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>dye<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items! To dye a piece of gear, you must first have the proper colorant. Colorant can be crafted or purchased in stores.

Once you have the proper colorant, dyeing an item is as easy as selecting the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Dye icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> interface.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>There is no limit to how many times an item can be dyed. Dye can also be removed by using an item called <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>terebinth<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
It should be noted, however, that certain items require the completion of quests before they can be dyed.

If you wish to paint a housing fixture or furnishing, you can do so by selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Furnishing Color<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> by accessing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Housing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> within the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Social<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> menu. Alternately, furnishings can also be painted when selected from the inventory.
You can now extract materia from items!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Materia extracted from one piece of gear can be affixed to another, improving its attributes.

To extract materia from an item, you must have first created a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>spiritbond<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> with it by using the piece repeatedly in battle, crafting, or gathering. Once an item's spiritbond reaches 100%, you will be able to select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Extract Materia<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the list of available subcommands.

Once materia is extracted from an item, its spiritbond will be reduced to 1%.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Affixing materia to an item can be done by a Disciple of the Hand with the proper training, or by speaking with materia melder NPCs. Should you wish to remove materia, you may do so by highlighting it and selecting <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Retrieve Materia<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

You can now meld materia to items!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Gear can be enhanced significantly by affixing materia to the slots available on most weapons, tools, and armor. The number of slots available on a piece of gear can be confirmed by viewing its help text.

To affix materia to an item, highlight a piece of gear and select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Meld<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the subcommands. Next, select the materia which you wish to affix. Similarly, should you wish to remove materia, you may do so by highlighting it and selecting <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Remove Materia<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

By learning the general action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Advanced Materia Melding<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, you can now attempt to attach materia to gear which has all its materia slots filled.

While the benefits of having multiple materia attached to your gear can be great, success is not guaranteed, and the consequences for failure can be great for a botched meld will result in the loss of the materia.
The level of an item also plays a role in who can or cannot enhance the gear, requiring higher level crafters as the level of the item increases.

If you lack the ability to meld your materia to an item, you may enlist the aid of other players or speak with a materia melder NPC. Another option is to find a similar piece of armor with materia already attached. The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>markets<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are a perfect place to find specially crafted items synthesized by Disciples of the Hand from across Eorzea.

Another option is to find another PC to meld the materia for you. One way to do this is via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Player Search<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> feature. Once you have found a PC capable of doing the meld and terms have been agreed upon, target the player and select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Request Meld<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>subcommands<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

The Disciple of the Land actions <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Truth of Forests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Truth of Mountains<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> enable you to detect <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>unspoiled<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> gathering locations and display their location on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

These special sites cannot be found with <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Lay of the Land<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Arbor Call<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, nor are they always present in the field. Furthermore, they may take hours or days to return once spent.

Upon successfully gathering an item from one of these locations, the times at which it can be gathered will appear in your gathering log. Proceed with caution, however, as these points are known to dissipate upon abandoning gathering.

Upon accessing certain high-level gathering points, you may find that items are <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>out of reach<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. To find out what these items are, you will have to spend your turns clearing away excess growth or debris.
If you are lucky, you may find a rare item. If not, you may find the slot barren. Either way, you will not know until the debris is removed.

The higher your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gathering<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating, the more debris you will clear with each attempt. There are also high-level actions such as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Toil of the Pioneer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Toil of the Mountaineer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> that, when used, instantly clear away all debris at a gathering point, allowing you to see where the items are located without having to use up your attempts.

Miners can use pickaxes and other digging tools to mine the mountains of Eorzea and gather materials for use in crafting. Locations that are prime for mining are known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mineral deposits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Mineral deposits are only discernible from other stones when using the action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Prospect<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. While this action is active, the location of mineral deposits is displayed on the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Once you have arrived at a mineral deposit, select it to begin mining.

In addition to mining, miners can use secondary tools to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>quarry<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items from patches of stone referred to as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rocky outcrops<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. As is the case with mineral deposits, these locations are only discernible when using the action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Prospect<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

To quarry, you must first equip a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sledgehammer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>off hand<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Sledgehammers can be obtained from shops, markets, or quests.

To fish, you must first change your class to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>fisher<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> by equipping a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rod<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main hand<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

If the body of water you are near is fishable, the icon for the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Cast<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> action will glow. Determine a bait to apply to your line by selecting the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Bait<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> action and then checkmarking the desired item from the list that appears.

Some bait can only be used in certain locations or for landing certain types of fish. Bait and tackle can be harvested, made by Disciples of the Hand, or purchased from various merchants or fieldcraft vendors. Always make sure your inventory is stocked before heading out into the wild.

Your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>fishing log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> contains invaluable information on everything from fishing hole locations, to detailed fish data, to personal records. The log can be found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Logs<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

In addition to bait, there exist several types of man-made <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>lures<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Lures are applied to your line in the same manner as bait.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Fish can sense the difference between live bait and lures; therefore it may take longer for you to register a bite.

On the other hand, lures can be reused multiple times, as well as employed to land prey too large for smaller bait. Being able to choose the right bait or lure for the situation is what separates the amateur from the professional.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Mooching<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a technique that involves catching a smaller fish, and then leaving that fish on the line to lure in a larger fish. Mooching can only be attempted after catching a large-sized fish that is <hex:021A020203>also<hex:021A020103> suitable for mooching.

There are some varieties of fish that can only be landed via mooching. Increase your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>perception<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating to increase your chances of landing a massive catch, and then use that fish to lure in an even rarer find.

No water, no problem! In Eorzea, experienced fishers find casting their lines into deserts (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>dunefishing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) and off mountain cliffs (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>skyfishing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) just as rewarding as casting them into a lake or river.

Once you have learned the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> that unlock these special techniques, you will next need to equip your tackle box with special sky- and dunefishing bait.

The higher your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>perception<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating, the better chance you have of landing a large-sized fish. Depending on the variety, it may be usable for <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mooching<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Scattered about Eorzea there are legendary <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>fishing holes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> that only a handful of fishers can recognize amongst the normal waters. Once you have learned <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gulleye<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, perhaps you, too, can try your luck at these prime fishing locations.
A treasure coffer has appeared! Ofttimes, leve targets will drop treasure while being pursued. If you don't claim it, someone else will, so what are you waiting for?

You have discovered a wanted target. While not necessary to complete the leve objectives, defeating the enemy will earn you a portion of the bounty placed on its head. Take care, however, for these targets are usually quite powerful.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Instanced raids<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are party-based content which take place in closed environments such as dungeons. To add to the challenge, instanced raids have numerous requirements such as time limits, level restrictions, and limitations of changing classes or jobs while within.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Finally, raids can be joined either by forming a party and speaking with the NPC at the entrance, or by using the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Finder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to automatically pair you with other adventurers around the world with the same ambitions.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Melee-oriented<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> classes such as gladiator and marauder can chain together their <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>weaponskills<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to deal additional damage or inflict additional enfeeblements to their targets. If a weaponskill can be chained with another, it will be indicated in the weaponskill's help text under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Combo Action<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. In the case of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Vorpal Thrust<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (to the left), if executed immediately after <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>True Thrust<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, the potency will be increased.
Some weaponskills must be delivered from a specified <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>direction<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to maximize their damage.

When a weaponskill can be chained into a combo, its <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hotbar icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will be outlined with a flashing yellow border. The border will fade if the weaponskill is not used within a certain amount of time.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Learn which weaponskills chain together to maximize your battle efficiency.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Astral Fire<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Umbral Ice<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are special status effects which allow thaumaturges to continuously deal devastating amounts of damage while still conserving their MP reserves.

Casting one of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Fire<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> spells gives a thaumaturge the effect of Astral Fire, which increases the potency and MP cost of further Fire spells. At the same time, it lowers the potency and MP cost of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Blizzard<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> spells, but prevents the natural or spell-assisted gradual restoration of MP.

Conversely, casting one of the Blizzard spells gives a thaumaturge the effect of Umbral Ice, which decreases the MP cost of Ice spells and recovers MP upon landing an Ice spell. At the same time, it lowers the potency and MP cost of Fire spells.

As a thaumaturge progresses in level, the number of Umbral Ice and Astral Fire effects which can be stacked at any one time increases─the larger the stack, the more powerful the effect.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Learning when to switch between fire and ice is key to being successful in extended battles.

Unlike other melee classes, pugilist weaponskills are used to cycle three unique battle <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>forms<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> which dictate the flow of weaponskill combos.

Many pugilist weaponskills will either change your form upon execution, or require you to be in a certain form to execute. There are also weaponskills which will grant damage bonuses when executed while in a certain form. The three types of forms are as follows: <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>raptor<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>coeurl<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>opo-opo<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

By successfully changing your form from opo-opo to raptor to coeurl, precisely in that order, you will be granted an increase to attack potency, as well as other additional effects based on the weaponskills executed.
Swiftly flowing from one form to the next as the situation demands is key to becoming proficient in the art of the monk.

The pet hotbar is preset with all the pet commands currently available to you, freeing up your normal hotbars for your personal actions and spells.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Allagan tomestones<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are relics of a long-lost civilization which perished several ages past. It is said that they contain the knowledge of the Allagan Empire, and as such are highly sought out by collectors around Eorzea.

These include job-specific gear, seasonal event garb, and so forth. You can determine whether or not an item can be stored in the armoire by viewing its item help window.

Please note that only items with <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>condition<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> at <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>100%<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or above can be stored. Each of the three nations has established a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>residential district<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, wherein like-minded adventurers can establish a base for their activities.

Each residential district is divided into <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>wards<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which in turn house 60 plots of land each. Wealthy individuals may purchase plots of land upon which to build their own estate halls, while free companies may jointly purchase plots. Those seeking simpler quarters may instead purchase a room in the apartment buildings found in each of the residential districts.

Estate halls and apartments can be customized by installing fixtures and placing furnishings. Please note that, in the case of estate halls, specific company privileges are required for customization.
More information on housing can be had by speaking with the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>resident caretaker<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> stationed at each residential district.

By the entrance of each plot of land, you will find a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>placard<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Interacting with the placard will bring up information on the owner, if available.

In the event that the plot is for sale, the current price will be displayed along with information as to whether it can be bought via lottery or on a first-come-first-served basis. More information on buying land can be had by speaking with the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>resident caretaker<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> stationed at each residential district.
