Doing so will change it into a key item known as a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>treasure map<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which, true to its name, will reveal to you the location of a hidden cache of riches.

Please note that you can only possess one treasure map at any given time. If you wish to decipher another timeworn map, you must either find the current hidden cache, or simply discard the map leading to it.

Using a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>treasure map<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will bring up a window that reveals the rough whereabouts of a hidden cache. It is then up to you to cross-reference the area map and pinpoint its precise location.

Upon arriving at the specified location, use the general action <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Dig<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to locate and extract the treasure. Barring any navigational errors, a chest laden with bounty will appear.
Be fairly warned! The chest may be rigged with a trap that lures ferocious creatures to you. You must defeat them if you are to walk away with life, limb, and loot.

The societies you encounter in your travels are beset with myriad problems. By helping each community resolve its issues through <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>allied society quests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, you can improve your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>reputation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> among its members.
The quests that are available change on a daily basis, and you can accept up to twelve in a single day. However, you cannot accept a new quest while the previous day's is still in progress.

To view your reputation among the allied societies, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Reputation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> menu. By winning the trust of their members, not only will you gain an insight into their lives, you will also be initiated into their mysteries.

Completing an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>allied society quest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will improve your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>reputation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> with that society. When your reputation has risen sufficiently, you will be able to raise it to the next rank by undertaking a special quest.
As your bond with the society strengthens, you will be able to purchase an ever-expanding range of items from their vendors.
These societies deal in wares found nowhere else, and the only way to obtain them is to win their trust!

Certain duties require you to carry an object and deliver it to a destination. While carrying an object, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>transporting icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will appear in your status bar. The timer above this icon indicates the amount of time you have left to complete the delivery.
Receiving damage while transporting incurs a time penalty. If the timer falls to zero, you will drop the object and be unable to continue the duty.

Through sylphic magicks, you can become <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>transparent<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and infiltrate enemy territory undetected. While in this state, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>transparent icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will appear in your status bar. The timer below this icon indicates the amount of time you have left before the enchantment wears off.
Certain points along your route extend the duration of your transparency; use them wisely while avoiding detection. Be warned that you cannot perform any actions while transparent.

When riding certain mounts, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>pet hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> featuring special actions will appear. These actions can be of great help in certain duties, so use them well.

When riding certain mounts, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>pet hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> featuring special actions will appear. These actions can be of great help in certain duties, so use them well.

You have befriended Jandelaine! By using the crystal bell found in your inn room, you can call upon the services of the flamboyant <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>aesthetician<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

From hair style and color to face paint, he can create a new look for you for a mere <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>2,000 gil<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Whenever you feel like a change, Jandelaine is your man.

When using the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Roulette<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, you will be assigned a random duty from among those you have unlocked. In return for leaving your destination in the hands of fate, you will receive enhanced rewards.

Furthermore, should you happen to be an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>adventurer in need<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─that is to say, your role is in short supply─you will receive an additional bonus.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Vote dismiss<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a function whereby players who are absent for extended periods or harass others can be democratically expelled from the party. To initiate a vote, first select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Party Members<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Party<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> section of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Next, select the party member you wish to nominate for dismissal, then <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Vote Dismiss<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the submenu. You will be required to select a reason for dismissal. Please be warned that unjustified usage of vote dismiss is a punishable act.

When vote dismiss is initiated, party members will be prompted for their response. If more than half vote <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Yes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, the player in question will be dismissed from the party.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Player commendation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a system whereby you can commend a party member who left a positive impression upon you in the course of duty.

Upon the conclusion of a duty, the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Player Commendation<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button will appear in the bottom right of the screen. Selecting it will bring up an interface wherein you can commend a player. Please note that commendations cannot be given to those who were in your party at the time of duty registration.
Commendations can be accumulated over time. By receiving a certain amount, you will unlock achievements that grant special rewards. It pays to play nice!

You can apply to join a free company from its <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>profile<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> page. Review the company's focus, times active, and the roles it is seeking, then <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>submit<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> your application if you believe you've found a good match.

If your application is approved, you will formally join the company. Review your current application by selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Free Company<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Social<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. From here, you can also <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>withdraw<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> your application should you have a change of heart.

If your application is approved, you will formally join the company. Review your current application by selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Free Company<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Social<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. From here, you can also <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>withdraw<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> your application should you have a change of heart.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>challenge log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> contains a list of adventuring objectives across a wide range of categories. Completing any one of these objectives will earn you rewards. Completion status is reset on a weekly basis, and it is possible to undertake the challenges repeatedly.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>challenge log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> contains a list of adventuring objectives across a wide range of categories. Completing any one of these objectives will earn you rewards. Completion status is reset on a weekly basis, and it is possible to undertake the challenges repeatedly.

Each unique challenge you complete counts towards the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Overall Completion<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> category, which yields additional rewards. As you progress in level and advance in the scenario, more challenge objectives will become available, giving you the chance to garner richer bonuses.

You have obtained a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>master recipe book<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. To learn the advanced recipes contained within, simply use the book in your inventory. The recipes will then appear under the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Master Recipes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> category of your crafting log.

Glamours allow you to alter the appearance of equipment through the use of illusory magicks. To change the appearance of an item, highlight it and select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Cast Glamour<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the subcommands.

Casting glamours requires catalysts known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>glamour prisms<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Please note that, for the illusion to take effect, the projected gear must be compatible with the glamoured gear's level, class, race, and gender.

Glamoured items cannot be sold or traded. Furthermore, the item lending its likeness will become bound to you. With these conditions in mind, by using glamours, you can always look <hex:021A020203>and<hex:021A020103> perform your best!

It is possible to grow a diverse variety of plants in both your garden patch and in flowerpots. To get started, you will need to obtain <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>seeds<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>soil<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Soil comes in various grades, and influences crop yield and quality.
Seeds and soil can be obtained through gathering by botanists and miners respectively. Once you have both, you may start growing a plant in an empty flowerpot or empty bed in your garden patch.
The plants in your garden require constant tending if they are to thrive and yield crops. Plants that are neglected for too long will wither and die.
Fertilizer can be used to enrich the soil and accelerate growth, and can be applied on any one plant up to once per hour (Earth time).
Your garden has crops which are ready for harvest. When you harvest a plant and obtain its produce, it will disappear from the garden patch.

In the event that different plant species were growing side by side in a garden bed, they may also render up new kinds of seeds. Through experimentation, you can look forward to some truly surprising yields!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Intercrossing cannot be done using flowerpots.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ventures<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are tasks which send retainers afield on procurement expeditions. Retainers can be instructed to either bring back specified items, or explore certain terrains for whatever items may be found, be they riches or refuse. It should be noted that retainers well equipped for their journey may return with greater spoils.

Assigning a venture requires a payment in a unique currency of the same name─<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ventures<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Ventures can be acquired through a variety of methods such as exchanging company seals, fulfilling leve objectives, and completing allied society quests.

Even while on a venture, retainers will promptly answer your call when summoned, and likewise can be sent to tend to your wares at the markets. Be certain to put these resourceful men and women to good use!<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Please note that you will not be refunded any venture payments if you cancel an active venture.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

One of two main venture types, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>exploration<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> sends your retainer to scour the terrain of your choosing for (hopefully) precious items. There is no telling what he or she will find.
Indeed, there are certain rare items which can only be obtained through ventures, so make a point of dispatching your retainer as often as your resources allow.

You can communicate with other players via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat input<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> bar situated below the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Having selected the bar, enter your message, then press the Enter key.

You can communicate with other players via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat input<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> bar situated below the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Having selected the bar, enter your message, then press <hex:021E020903>.

The recipients of your message are determined by the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat mode<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> currently in use. The chat mode is set to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Say<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> by default. In this mode, your message is sent to all players within a small radius around you.
The chat mode can be changed at any time via the speech bubble icon located below the chat log.

Popular chat modes include <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Tell<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which sends a message to a specific player, and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Party<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location.

The world of Eorzea is home to adventurers of various cultural and linguistic backgrounds. In order to facilitate communication in this diverse environment, the game includes a feature known as the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>auto-translation dictionary<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

To use the dictionary, select the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat input<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> bar situated below the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, then press the Tab key. A list of auto-translate categories for words and expressions will appear.

To use the dictionary, select the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat input<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> bar situated below the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>chat log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, then press the <hex:021E020E03> button. A list of auto-translate categories for words and expressions will appear.

Selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>2: 【Greetings】<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and then <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>3: Hello!<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will produce the text<hex:02100103><hex:0212023703>Hello!<hex:0212023803> in the chat input bar enclosed in special parentheses.
When sent, such text will automatically be translated into the client language being used by the recipients.
The auto-translation dictionary contains a list of everyday words and expressions as well as game-specific terms. We hope that it will prove useful during your adventures with players the world over.

Should a particular item in the marketplace catch your eye, you can add it to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>wish list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. This list can contain a maximum of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ten<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items at one time.

The total number of players who fancy a given item will be displayed in search results, providing a quick reference as to current demand.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Please be advised that all wish list data will be cleared when Worlds undergo maintenance.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Your retainer can be assigned any one class, with the exception of those of the Disciples of the Hand. While it is possible to reassign classes, please be warned that your retainer's progress in the current class will be reset.
A retainer's class determines which ventures he or she may embark upon. Retainers gain in level by completing ventures, but their level will never exceed your own.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Trials of the Braves<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a collection of sacred texts spanning nine books, each of which contains a series of objectives for enhancing your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>relic weapon atma<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. They can be acquired by exchanging Allagan tomestones with <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>G'jusana<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> at Revenant's Toll.

Each book will appear in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Key Items<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> section of your inventory. By vanquishing all the foes listed therein with your relic weapon atma equipped, your weapon will undergo evolution.

Upon fulfilling the objectives of all nine books, your weapon will be ready to complete its evolution and become a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>relic weapon animus<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─one step closer to one of the transcendent Zodiac Weapons.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>※Please note that you can only possess one book at any given time.

By infusing <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sphere scrolls<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> with the materia of your choice, you can enhance a relic weapon animus as you see fit. To infuse a sphere scroll with materia, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Infuse<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from its subcommands.

Each sphere scroll can be infused with up to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>seven<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> types of materia, granting a bonus to attributes, casting times, and more. Please note that up to five materia can be infused onto a single scroll. Materia will be consumed upon infusion.

While grade I materia will suffice for initial infusions, progressively higher grades of materia will be required to enhance an attribute past certain points. Moreover, there are limits as to how many times a given attribute may be enhanced.

Each infusion requires the use of a catalyst known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>alexandrite<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Alexandrite can be obtained in exchange for Allied Seals or found by traveling to locations marked on <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mysterious maps<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> obtained through select quests. The material can also be obtained by participating in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>FATEs<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> with your relic weapon animus equipped.

Once you have fully infused a sphere scroll with materia, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Jalzahn<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can use it to enhance the corresponding relic weapon animus.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>In the future, it will be possible to undo this process and apply different enhancements, should you so desire.

The Borderland Ruins located on the outskirts of the Carteneau Flats are now accessible! Control of this ancient Allagan site is decided via large-scale player-versus-player (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>PvP<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>) battles known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Frontline campaigns<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Speak with a Grand Company <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>flyer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> at one of the airship landings for further details.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Repair NPCs<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can only restore an item's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>condition<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to 100%. Repairing the same item yourself, however, will raise its condition beyond 100%, allowing for extended use before it wears down again.

If you meet the class conditions for repairing an item, you need not even change to that class to complete the action.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Item condition is reset to 100% when placed in an armoire.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sightseeing log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a comprehensive record of breathtaking landscapes and stunning vistas you have discovered across Eorzea. Vistas are only recorded upon discovering the exact location noted in Millith's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>impressions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sightseeing log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a comprehensive record of breathtaking landscapes and stunning vistas you have discovered across Eorzea. Vistas are often difficult to reach, some requiring sprinting or jumping, and are only recorded upon discovering the exact location noted in Millith's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>impressions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Time of day<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>weather<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are also important to uncovering a vista, as are the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>emotes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> you perform once you have arrived at one. Millith's impressions will often contain hints on these hidden conditions, though you may still need all your wits to discover some of the more obscure entries.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Once an entry is completed, a rough sketch and information on the location's history will be added to your log.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Allied Seals<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are a type of common currency minted by the three Grand Companies forming the Eorzean Alliance. The seals are most commonly distributed as reward for tracking down and slaying <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>marks<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> designated in the realm-wide <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Hunt<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Mark bills<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (posted once a day, Earth time) and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>elite mark bills<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (posted once a week, Earth time) can be accepted at <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Hunt boards<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> located across Eorzea. Completing the objectives on these bills will present you with the opportunity to earn even more Allied Seals.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Allied Seals can be exchanged for various weapons and items. Speak with a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Hunt billmaster<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for further details.

You have acquired a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>toy chest<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> containing several <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mini-games<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Visit an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>inn room<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to try your hand at these popular Eorzean pastimes.

Targeting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>artillery<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and pressing the confirm button will bring up a temporary <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> containing a new set of artillery-specific actions.

Selecting an action will display a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>target circle<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> indicating where the siege engine will fire. Position the circle carefully to maximize its effectiveness.

Every good fisher knows even Nophica's bounty is not limitless, and will therefore return to the water any unwanted catches so that the Matron may take them to Her bosom once more. This is called <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>releasing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and the action is available to all fishers. Released fish will not be added to your inventory, preserving area populations.

Once you have released a certain type of fish, you will continue to release that fish should you catch it again in the same location. If you wish to stop releasing fish, you must first end your fishing session and cast your line anew.

You are now able to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>desynthesize<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> items, reducing them to their original materials! To desynthesize an item, you must first be a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>level 30 Disciple of the Hand<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Select an item and choose <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Desynthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from its subcommands to begin the dismantling process.

Each discipline has its own desynthesis <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>skill level<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. If your desynthesis skill is higher than the optimal skill rating for an item, there is an increased chance of receiving rare items.
You will always successfully desynthesize items regardless of your desynthesis skill level, so never hesitate to desynthesize items you no longer need.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Chocobo raising<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is now available! To begin raising your trusty companion, you must first <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>stable<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> him. Chocobo stables can be purchased and placed outside free company and private <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>estates<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. One chocobo stable can house a whole company's mounts.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Apartment buildings include a chocobo stable that is shared by all tenants.<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>

While a chocobo is stabled, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Train<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to increase his EXP. After the training is complete, do not forget to give the chocobo a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>reward<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for his hard work. Depending on the type of reward the bird is given, his progress may change dramatically.
Continuously <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>feeding<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> your chocobo a snack of vibrant vegetables or fruits will cause him to grow feathers of a different color.

There exist certain fishing holes that are hidden in plain sight, and can only be found after reading the detailed descriptions found in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>tomes of regional folklore<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
You can discern which fish can be found in these elusive fishing holes by viewing your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>fishing log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Extensive spearfishing is said to, on occasion, upset the balance of the ecosystem in a given area. In fact, it has been known to draw more rare and elusive varieties of fish, often found hiding in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>swimming shadows<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Should you suspect such murky waters are close by, you can determine their exact location using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Truth of Oceans<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

You have added an item of interest to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collection<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Other such keepsakes found on your adventures will be stored here, viewable at any time should you wish to reflect on your past deeds.

You have added an item of interest to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collection<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Other such keepsakes found on your adventures will be stored here, viewable at any time should you wish to reflect on your past deeds.

You must be a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Disciple of the Hand<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to accept or complete Ehcatl Nine society quests. Items required to complete these quests can only be synthesized after equipping a pair of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ehcatl wristgloves<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Experience points earned by completing these quests will be allocated to your current class. The amount of experience awarded upon completion can be viewed in your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>journal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and will automatically update in the event you change your class.

You will earn <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>quota points<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for each item submitted during an Ehcatl Nine delivery quest. Only by earning enough points will you meet your quota and complete the quest. The list of items currently sought by the Ixali faction can be viewed via the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Timers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> interface located under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu.
Any of the items on the list can be submitted towards your quota. The icon to the left of the item name indicates which Disciple of the Hand class will earn experience points for delivery.

Unlike other society quests, you will not be allowed to reaccept a delivery quest in the event you abandon it, and must wait a day (Earth time) before being issued another allowance. Moreover, the list of currently sought items will be updated each day at <hex:0206020103><hex:020821DBFF1D><hex:020919DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C03><hex:0D03> <hex:020810E0DB0DFF05>p.m.<hex:FF05>a.m.<hex:03> (Earth time), and items previously sought may no longer be accepted.

Outfitting your level 50 retainer with the proper gear will increase her chances of finding rare items while on exploration ventures. After assigning your retainer a quick exploration venture, keep an eye on your log window for a message telling you whether or not her current equipment is sufficient.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Transfiguration<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is the term used to describe when a character has temporarily taken on a physical form drastically different from their normal one. The status can be removed at any time by selecting it.
The status will also be removed upon logging out or leaving the current area.

Your relic weapon novus can now be <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>soulglazed<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! Speak with Jalzahn to have him apply the coating so that you may begin <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>attuning<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> soul energy to the item by wielding it in battle.

Use a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Zodiac glass<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> while equipped with a relic weapon novus to determine the item's current level of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>soul attunement<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. If you happen to misplace your Zodiac glass, a new one can be obtained from <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Drake<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Hyrstmill.
Participating in certain duties will accelerate the rate with which soul attunement is achieved. Inquire with other adventurers as to which activities yield the best results.

Once you believe soul attunement has been achieved, take your weapon back to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Jalzahn<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Hyrstmill to complete the upgrading process.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Remember, soul energy can only attune to weapons which have been soulglazed. If you decide to enhance additional relic weapons, do not forget to first take them to Jalzahn.

You have thinned the population of fish in this area enough to lure forth a rare species which normally remains hidden. There are several types of these timid wavekin in waters, sands, and skies across Eorzea.
These rare fish, however, will not remain in the area for long, so once you have detected one, focus all your efforts on not letting him be the “one that got away.”

You have caught an elusive fish that will only appear when one specific weather type follows another! There are several types of these fickle creatures in waters, sands, and skies across Eorzea, so keep an eye out for meteorological changes while casting your line.

In addition to their deadly weaponskills, ninjas have at their disposal special battle techniques known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ninjutsu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which are readied by first making a series of ritual hand gestures known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mudra<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Ninjutsu can be executed after combining one or more of the following three mudra in a predetermined order:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Ten (Heaven)<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Chi (Earth)<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Jin (Man)<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>
You will learn new mudra as you progress through the ninja storyline. Learning new mudra will open the door to more complex ninjutsu techniques.

Once you have obtained a new ninjutsu technique, you can confirm the proper mudra order required to execute it by selecting its icon in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> interface.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ceremony of Eternal Bonding<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a special rite of passage for two individuals wishing to pledge each other a lifetime of devotion. Only those who have proved their commitment through a long and perilous quest will be granted access to the Ivory Chapel where they will be united in the divine light of the Twelve.

This quest can be accepted at the Sanctum of the Twelve from the ceremony planner <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Claribel<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> upon meeting the following requirements:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You are currently in a party with your partner<hex:02100103>You both have equipped a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>promise wristlet<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>You both have completed the main scenario quest, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>The Scions of the Seventh Dawn<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Preparations for the final ceremony─both physical and spiritual─will be made during the course of Claribel's quest. This includes the selection of ceremony attire and the creation of rings.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Once the first step has been taken, countless more await. Let them be a test of your devotion!

Now that you have completed <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>The Ties that Bind<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, you may speak with ceremony planning assistant <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Raitmeaux<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to determine the particulars of your big day. Both you and your partner will have the opportunity to request how the ceremony will be held, however, only the decisions made by one of you will be reflected, so make sure you both select the same options.

Permission to use the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ivory Chapel<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─the hallowed hall within the Sanctum of the Twelve used for Bonding Ceremonies─must be granted by Sanctum dedicant <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Etoinelle<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Reservations can be made at any time, with schedules for each week being posted at <hex:020706FE545C8A1003><hex:020821DBFF1D><hex:020919DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C03><hex:0D03>:00 <hex:020810E0DB0DFF05>p.m.<hex:FF05>a.m.<hex:03> every Friday (Earth time). If in the event you are forced to cancel a reservation, you must wait until the next week to make a new one.

Upon completing your chapel reservation, the dedicant will present you with a customizable invitation which you can send to guests.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Please note that due to server issues, there may be times unavailable for reservation.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

On the day of the ceremony, you must first speak with Etoinelle to gain admittance to the Sanctum. Once inside, you will be presented with an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>eternity bell<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> which is rung when you wish to proceed to the next stage of the ceremony.

You have received an invitation to a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ceremony of Eternal Bonding<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to be held at the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Sanctum of the Twelve<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Please take care not to discard or trade the item.

The date and time of the ceremony are detailed in the invitation's help text. Speak with dedicant <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Etoinelle<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to gain admittance to the Sanctum.

You now possess a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>fledgling chocobo registration form<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! This document grants you sole ownership of a newly hatched chocobo bred specially to race.

Until its maiden race, your fledgling will be trained and cared for by the chocobokeeps at <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Moogle's Gift Mounts<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in Bentbranch Meadows. If you happen to lose your registration form, ownership is rescinded, so store the document in a safe location.

After officially registering your fledgling as a race chocobo, it will be moved from Bentbranch Meadows to the stables at the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Manderville Gold Saucer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. All further training will be conducted here.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Remember, adventurers may only own a single race chocobo. If you would like another, you must first retire the one you currently possess.

Your race chocobo has learned an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>There are two types of race abilities. The first are active abilities which are automatically set to the race hotbar, allowing you the freedom to choose the timing of their execution. The second type includes latent traits─such as resistance against certain enfeeblements─which remain active for the duration of a race.

Some abilities are passed down from a chocobo's parents. These are called <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>hereditary<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Others are learned. These are called <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>acquired<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

While hereditary abilities cannot be forgotten, acquired ones can by using a bottle of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>lethe water<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If you have the means to afford them, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>training manuals<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can be purchased to teach your race chocobo the ability of your choice.

Your race chocobo has achieved rank 40!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Rank 40 chocobos can be retired without handing over complete ownership to the Manderville Gold Saucer. Once retired, a chocobo can be bred, resulting in a new chocobo for you to train and race. This process is called <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>covering<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

The type of fledgling chocobo that is born as a result of covering is based solely on the pedigree and pedigree level of its parents. Pedigree level is determined by the strength of a chocobo's individual attributes such as acceleration and cunning.

While the pedigree of both parents plays a role in determining the pedigree level of a newborn fledgling, the blood of the lower-leveled parent will often have more influence on the resulting offspring.

Finally, if you do not have both a male and female chocobo retired, you can hire a breeding chocobo for the covering process. Stock with higher pedigree levels will, of course, require more MGP to use.

Before you can create a deck with your new Triple Triad cards, you must first <hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>claim<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> them. Open up your inventory and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Use<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> a card to claim it. Once you have claimed enough cards to make a deck (at least five), select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gold Saucer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. From there, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Card Decks<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to begin building your masterpiece.

Once you've built a deck, all that's left is to find an opponent and challenge them to a match.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If you have any questions on how to play Triple Triad, be sure to ask the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Triple Triad master<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for a private lesson.

You have now entered the world of Triple Triad match play. If you see someone with a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>card icon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> next to their name, it means they are currently seeking a match.

Triple Triad matches are not only limited to the confines of the Manderville Gold Saucer. You can seek a match with other PCs anywhere in Eorzea.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Good luck and may the Spinner's pull be ever kind!
Welcome to the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Manderville Gold Saucer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, where all your dreams can come true!

That is, all your dreams can come true <hex:021A020203>if<hex:021A020103> you have enough Manderville Gold Saucer points (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>MGP<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>). Gil can be exchanged for MGP at the main counter in the middle of Entrance Square. The current rate is 10 gil for one MGP. Ul'dahn law prevents the Gold Saucer from exchanging MGP if the patron already possesses more than 500.

MGP cannot be converted back into gil, but the points can be used to purchase an assortment of wonderful prizes from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>prize claim<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> attendant, also located at the main counter in Entrance Square.

Your race chocobo has gone up in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rank<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The types of races your chocobo can participate in are determined by its <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rating<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The higher the rating, the more prestigious the races made available to you and your steed will become.
Your chocobo's rating is determined by several factors, including its rank and pedigree.
To ensure chocobos are evenly matched, lower class races will become unavailable once a steed achieves a certain rating.

You have received a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Soul of the Crafter<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! Trading it for a specialized soul will allow you to become a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>specialist<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in that particular discipline.

Specialists will be able to access unique actions that allow for more efficient and higher-quality synthesis in their specialized fields. You may select up to three different disciplines in which to specialize.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Adding, removing, or changing a specialty can be done at any time, but please note that new Souls of the Crafter may be difficult to acquire.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Specialties cannot be changed more than three times a week (Earth time).<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Some NPCs will seek to barter with you for your collectables, but will require that the items are of a certain collectability. Confirm these numbers before gathering or crafting a collectable, lest you procure an item no one wants.

You have gained the ability to take flight! Summon forth a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>flying mount<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and try <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>jumping<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to take off.

Flying consists of three basic maneuvers:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Advancing<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103> Movement keys<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ascending<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103> Jump key<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Descending<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103> Draw/sheathe weapon key

Your expansive knowledge and experience has qualified you to assume the role of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mentor<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! As a mentor, your primary task will be to provide guidance and assistance to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>new adventurers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> as well as any other troubled heroes who might be in need of your accumulated wisdom.

Upon receiving certification from the Smith, the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>mentor<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> setting will become available as one of your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>online status<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> options.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Setting this status will allow other adventurers to identify you as a mentor.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Three additional settings are also available to specify your field of expertise: <hex:0212025003> PvE Mentor, <hex:0212025203> PvP Mentor, and <hex:0212025103> Trade Mentor.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Should you qualify as both a battle and trade mentor, you will also be able to choose to status <hex:0212024F03> Mentor, which marks you as an expert in all fields.

While you retain the position of mentor, you will be able to invite new adventurers to the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Novice Network<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─an exclusive chat channel where beginners can seek the advice of veteran players. Battle mentors also gain access to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Roulette: Mentor<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which offers special rewards, so don't be shy about aiding your fellow adventurers!

In addition to regular gathering points, there also exist nodes known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>ephemeral gathering points<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Even though these points may appear in your gathering log, depending on the time of day, they may remain hidden in the field.

While the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Whisperer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> traits (<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Stone Whisperer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for miners, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Tree Whisperer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for botanists) grant you the ability to recognize a gathering node's hidden characteristics, there are some characteristics that require the acquisition of further traits to uncover.
Even then, the characteristics will not always be visible, so when they are, do not miss out on the chance to exploit them!

The item you just obtained is a perfect candidate for <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>aetherial reduction<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! Reducing an item breaks it down into its base aetherial components, or simply put, renders it into another item. Once an item is reduced, it is lost forever; however, depending on the original item's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, the number of resulting items may increase.

Among unspoiled gathering points, there are legendary sites that can be discovered by acquiring <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>tomes of regional folklore<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Each volume contains the tales and traditions of a particular region, and using the item adds this information to your gathering log under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Special<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Volumes you have yet to obtain can be reviewed in your gathering log. There are many valuable resources out there waiting to be found, and it begins by collecting tomes of regional folklore!

Whenever you open a treasure coffer, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>loot list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will appear. If someone in your party opens a coffer, you will first receive a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>notice<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the bottom right-hand corner of your screen. Clicking on this notice will bring up the loot list.

For each item in the chest, you will have the opportunity to select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Need<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Greed<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Pass<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Need: You really need the item.<hex:02100103>Greed: You want the item, but do not need it.<hex:02100103>Pass: You do not need the item.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Once everyone in your party has made their selections, the loot will be distributed automatically.

Players may change their selection to Pass after selecting Need or Greed, but once Pass has been selected, the decision is deemed final. If all party members choose Pass, then the item will be discarded.
Gil and quest-related items will be divided evenly amongst all party members.

Whenever you open a treasure coffer, a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>loot list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> will appear. If someone in your party opens a coffer, you will first receive a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>notice<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the bottom right-hand corner of your screen. Targeting and selecting this notice will bring up the loot list.

When participating in an instanced duty with a preformed or an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>unrestricted<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> party, the party leader can opt to employ either the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Lootmaster<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Greed Only<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> loot rules.

The current loot rule can be changed at any time within the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Finder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> settings, but only before a duty has commenced. The party leader should discuss any changes to the rule to avoid confusion amongst party members.

In Ishgard, levequests are not issued by the Adventurers' Guild, but by the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Temple Knights<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The system, however, remains much the same, the one difference being that in addition to normal levequests which require one leve allowance to accept, there are also <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>large-scale levequests<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> which require ten. These quests will require more effort, but yield richer rewards.

Treasure coffers discovered on the battlefield during battlecraft levequests will sometimes contain <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>amber-encased vilekin<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. These rare items can be exchanged with <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>amber traders<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for items unobtainable anywhere else.

You have obtained a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectable<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! The higher an item's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, the more attractive it is to certain NPCs who are seeking to purchase or trade for them.
Collectables cannot be stacked or sold to regular merchants, nor can they be consumed or used as material for synthesis.

Furthermore, there exist certain wares that can only be crafted as collectables. This can be confirmed both in its description and in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>crafting log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Using the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Collectable Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> command will grant you the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Collectable Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> status. While under the effect of this status, you will have the option to “finish” certain items as collectables after the final step of successful synthesis.

Increasing an item's quality through synthesis will also increase its <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. If, by the final step, the collectability achieved is not at a level deemed acceptable by the NPC seeking the item, it is best to complete the synthesis normally so that the item might be sold or used.

You have learned<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503> Collect<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─a special Disciple of the Land action that is used to gather an item as a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectable<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

While fishing under the effect of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Collector's Glove<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> status, fish landed will be gathered as collectables, their size directly affecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

While under the effect of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Collector's Glove<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> status, you will be given the option to gather items as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectables<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Items are now suitable for gathering as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectables<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Before gathering the item, use the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Appraisal<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> actions to increase its <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rarity<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, and in turn, its <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectability<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

While appraisal increases rarity, it also increases an item's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>wear<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. If wear increases beyond an item's limit, gathering rate will drop significantly.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Lord of Verminion<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a Gold Saucer-exclusive attraction in which you pit your personal minions against the minions of others in a game of skill and strategy. There are several different modes of play, from single-player challenges to realm-wide tournaments.

Gameplay is done through a special interface centered on your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minion hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The minion hotbar can be edited by selecting <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Verminion<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> located under the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gold Saucer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> option in your main menu.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>※Minions not set to your minion hotbar can still be summoned during matches.

When challenging other players in head-to-head battles, you will earn or lose <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rank points (RP)<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> depending on the outcome of the match. Your current RP total can be viewed under the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gold Saucer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> option in your main menu. RP is used to determine your ranking in the realm as well as determine opponents when entering general matches.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>※There are some match types in which RP are not affected by match outcome.

There are three types of matches available in Lord of Verminion─the Verminion Challenge, player battles, and tournaments.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Verminion Challenge<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>A series of themed battles designed to teach the game's rules. Your opponent will be an NPC known as a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Minion master<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Player Battles<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Matches played against other players. Depending on the battle type, RP totals may or may not be affected by match outcomes.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Tournaments<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Tournaments consist of multiple matches against other players, with victories earning you <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>tournament points<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. At the end of a tournament, the players with the most tournament points will be rewarded with prizes.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>※Tournaments will often feature special rules and restrictions.

Minions are categorized into four unique types─monster, critter, poppet, and gadget. The first three exhibit strengths and weaknesses against the others, with only gadgets being neither strong nor weak against any. This relationship in Lord of Verminion is called dominance.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Poppets<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are effective against <hex:024804F201F803><hex:024904F201F903>monsters<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> while ineffective against <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>critters<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Gadgets are not affected by dominance.

Some minions may also have strengths against playing field objects known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>structures<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. A minion's strengths can be viewed by selecting the minion in your <hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>minion hotbar<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minion list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

In addition to Arcana Stones, there are several other types of structures that can be found on the playing field.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Shield<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Shields protect Arcana Stones by reducing the amount of damage dealt to them by opponent minions. Destroying a shield increases Arcana Stone vulnerability.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Search Eye<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Search Eyes reveal the location of all enemy minions on the playing field. Damaging an opponent's Search Eye prevents them from seeing your minions until they are within proximity of one of their minions.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Gates<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Gates serve as minion summoning points, as well as teleportation devices, and sanctuaries in which minion HP is restored. None of these features are available if the gate is damaged.
Minions also cannot be harmed while within the boundaries of one of their side's gates.

Damaged or destroyed structures will automatically repair themselves over time. Gathering ally minions near a damaged structure accelerates the repairing process.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>※Arcana Stones cannot be repaired.

Certain quests employ an automatic level adjustment system known as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>quest sync<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which adjusts the difficulty and EXP rewards to your current level.

Please note that when accepting certain quests, a message will appear indicating that you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted the quest. In this case, changing your class or job will prevent completion of the quest's objectives.

Some quests will be marked with a <hex:024804F201F603><hex:024904F201F703><hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> icon. This indicates that you must play the quest using the same class or job with which you accepted it, and that changing classes or jobs at any time will prevent quest progress.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>orchestrion<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can be used to change the music in your estate or inn room, but only if you have first obtained song <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>rolls<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Rolls can be obtained through a variety of means including synthesis, purchase in shops, and discovery in treasure coffers. After obtaining a roll, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>use<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> it to add the track to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>orchestrion list<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Accessing an orchestrion will open the settings interface. From here you can listen to any tracks you have registered, as well as select that track to play in your estate or apartment. Shared estate background music can only be changed if you have been granted the proper authorization.
A feature unique to orchestrions in estates and apartments is the ability to register tracks to a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>playlist<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.

Up to eight songs can be registered to a playlist, which can then be played in order, shuffled, or a single track can be selected to play on repeat. Playback options for the playlist can be accessed via subcommands or the buttons found at the bottom of the playlist interface. Tracks not listed in the playlist can also be set as estate background music by using the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Select Track<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> option at the bottom of the interface.

It is possible to grow a number of decorative plants for your estate using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>flowerpots<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. The use of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>pomace<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> when tending to these potted plants can affect their color when they bloom. Fully grown plants can then be plucked and placed in a flower vase to decorate your estate.

After successfully locating and opening a treasure chest, there is a chance it will summon a teleportation portal. If you should find one, it can be used to transport yourself and any nearby party members to a treasure dungeon.

These vaults are comprised of several chambers. Each chamber contains a treasure coffer, the contents of which are increasingly more rare as you progress. To reach subsequent chambers, however, you must defeat several enemies to receive a key that will open one of the doors.
Choose your door carefully, as one will activate a trap which immediately expels trespassers from the vault. Pass all of the traps and fight your way to the final chamber to reap rich rewards!

Aquariums can be used to put on display the various fish you catch on your travels.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>They are available in four <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>tiers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (sizes), each tier able to hold a predetermined number of fish.

Before placing any fish in an aquarium, you may choose to fill the tank with either <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>fresh water<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>saltwater<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. This will dictate which types of fish can be placed in the aquarium. You may also select trimmings with which to decorate the inside of the tank.

Fish have been categorized into four sizes─<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>small<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (one unit), <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>medium<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (two units), <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>large<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (four units), and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>extra large<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> (seven units). It is worth noting that larger fish will occupy more space in an aquarium, leaving less room for other fish.

Aquariums are available in four tiers, the smallest holding only a single unit, and the largest holding up to seven. Because larger fish take up more room in the aquarium, one must choose carefully which fish they will put on display.

Glamours are now available for your summoner and scholar familiars. Applying them is as simple as typing in the following text command:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>/petglamour “summon name” “glamour” <hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

For example, if you wish to change the appearance of your Titan-Egi to Ruby Carbuncle, you need only enter<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>/petglamour “titan-egi” “ruby carbuncle”<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>and then cast Summon Titan.

Finally, there are two rules you must remember when using egi glamours.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>1. The text command must be executed before summoning your familiar as glamours will not be applied if it has already been summoned.<hex:02100103>2. Entering the text command without specifying a glamour will return your familiar to its original form.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Check the Lodestone for information on currently available glamours.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Leveling your character is crucial to unlocking Eorzea's end content; however, it is not the only value you need to keep your eye on. Almost as important as the level of your class/job is the level of your gear. The reason behind this is simple: all gear is not created equal, with items featuring a high <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>IL (item level)<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> most often stronger than those with a low IL.

While some high-level weapons and gear can be crafted or purchased in stores, the majority can be obtained in exchange for <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Allagan tomestones<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─special drops that can be found in instanced dungeons, raids, and on the Hunt.

Once you have collected enough tomestones, journey to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Revenant's Toll<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to outfit yourself with the best equipment the realm has to offer!
Each piece of gear in Eorzea is assigned a level to indicate its relative strength.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>average IL<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> of your currently equipped gear (including your accessories) is an important value that can determine not only whether or not you will have trouble in certain battles, but oftentimes whether or not you will even be allowed to participate.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Your current average IL can be viewed at any time under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> within the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
You will soon find that maintaining a high average item level is the key to success in tackling Eorzea's myriad challenges.
You (and all your flying mounts) have received the Kojin tribe's ancient blessing, and can now breathe underwater indefinitely!

To dive, you must first be swimming in a body of water that allows diving. Next, you simply need to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>descend<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> as you would with any flying mount (default: Ctrl+Space).<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If you are riding a flying mount, you can go from flying to diving by descending into the water at the proper angle.

To dive, you must first be swimming in a body of water that allows diving. Next, you simply need to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>descend<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> as you would with any flying mount by pressing <hex:021E020A03>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If you are riding a flying mount, you can go from flying to diving by descending into the water at the proper angle.

There are special emotes such as <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>/waterflip<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> that can only be used while underwater. These emotes are indicated by a unique icon.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are special actions that are available only during the course of specific quests or battles. Duty actions are used by left-clicking their icon, but can be bound to other keys.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty actions<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are special actions that are available only during the course of specific quests or battles. Duty actions are used by pressing <hex:021E021203> while holding down both <hex:021E020F03> and <hex:021E021003>.
Some duty actions can only be used a limited number of times. Deciding when or when not to use them can mean the difference between victory and a quick trip back to your Home Point.

You have been granted access to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Astragalos<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, an old Sharlayan testing site situated in the Dravanian hinterlands!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Here, you may take part in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Rival Wings<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, a large-scale war game incorporating powerful goblin-made machina. Adventurers are divided into two teams, the Falcons and the Ravens, with each side setting out to destroy the core located in the opponent's base. If you are interested in learning more, speak with Softknox at the Wolves' Den Pier.

You are now able to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>spearfish<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! However, to access this new feature, you must first equip a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gig<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in your off hand. If you do not already have one, gigs can be purchased from fieldcraft vendors or other shops that sell bait and tackle.

<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Teeming waters<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are home to many different kinds of elusive creatures. It is at these locations that you can use your gig to land catches that normally ignore a fisher's line.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Shark Eye<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can be used to identify the location of nearby teeming waters and display them on your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>minimap<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Target the teeming waters and press <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>confirm<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to begin spearfishing.

When bubbles appear within the teeming waters, it means a fish has approached. Use the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gig<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> command at this time to spear the creature and add it to your inventory.

There are several types of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gig heads<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> each specialized for catching different kinds of fish. If it looks like you are not having luck with your current head, change it! All gigs come complete with a set of interchangeable heads.

You have learned a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>role action<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Role actions are spells and weaponskills that are assigned to all the classes within a role (Tank, Melee DPS, Ranged DPS, Healer) rather than a specific class. Role actions are learned in the same manner as class actions─via leveling─but only need to be learned once to be able to use them with all participating classes within a role.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Role<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> section has been added to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Selecting it will display the role actions you have learned.

Use your harp to create sweet, sweet music by selecting a sound from <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Performance<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> located under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu. Then, simply use the keyboard to create your masterpiece! Remember, performance actions can only be used while your job is set to bard.

The realm's problems can wait until tomorrow, for today we dress like heroes and heroines in Masked Rose's <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Fashion Report<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> fashion challenges! New challenges are posted in the Gold Saucer every week (Earth time) on <hex:020603120303><hex:020942DDFF07>Sunday<hex:FF07>Monday<hex:FF08>Tuesday<hex:FF0A>Wednesday<hex:FF09>Thursday<hex:FF07>Friday<hex:FF09>Saturday<hex:03> at <hex:020821DBFF1D><hex:020919DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C03><hex:0D03> <hex:020810E0DB0DFF05>p.m.<hex:FF05>a.m.<hex:03> and are live for three days until <hex:020603120603><hex:020942DDFF07>Sunday<hex:FF07>Monday<hex:FF08>Tuesday<hex:FF0A>Wednesday<hex:FF09>Thursday<hex:FF07>Friday<hex:FF09>Saturday<hex:03> at <hex:020821DBFF1D><hex:020919DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C03><hex:0D03> <hex:020810E0DB0DFF05>p.m.<hex:FF05>a.m.<hex:03>.

Each challenge begins with themes given for 11 different equipment slots (not including off hand). Adventurers then choose from their wardrobes pieces of gear that they feel will complement those themes.

Masked Rose will judge adventurers' attire and award a score from 1 to 100 based on their coordination skills. Adventurers are given four opportunities per challenge to have their attire judged. It is recommended that adventurers share insight with each other on how they fared to determine what combinations of gear earn the highest scores.
MGP can be earned once per week for partaking in a Fashion Report, with bonus MGP being awarded to those who achieve a rating of 80 or above.

Is your inventory cluttered with gear you only wear on special occasions? Are glamour prisms causing you headaches? <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Glamour dressers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> have been added to inn rooms across the realm to make applying and managing glamoured gear simpler and more intuitive.

Start by adding gear to any glamour dresser where it is instantly transformed into a glamour. Next, use <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>glamour plates<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to create full sets of glamoured attire which can be applied to your character all at once.

If you come across a piece of gear whose design tickles your fancy, you may be able to store it in a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>glamour dresser<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> where it will be instantly transformed into a glamour. This can be confirmed via the item's help window. Once stored in the glamour dresser, images of the gear can be applied to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>glamour plates<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and then equipped via the plates at your leisure. Note, however, that gear stored in a glamour dresser can not be equipped until removed from the glamour dresser.

Images of gear stored in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>glamour dressers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> or your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>armoire<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can be applied to <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>glamour plates<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to create full sets of glamoured attire that can be equipped with a single command.

Glamour plates allow players to instantly equip an entire set of glamoured gear without expending glamour prisms.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Please note that glamour plates can only be used while in a large city or sanctuary.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

You have obtained your very own <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>magia board<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>! In Eureka, each creature is aspected to a certain element, giving them a distinct advantage in battle. You will need to make judicious use of both the magia board and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>magicite<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to overcome your foes.

Raise your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>affinity<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> to certain elements by melding magicite to your magia board or spinning the board to change its alignment. A magia board properly configured to an enemy's aetherial tilt can enhance both offensive and defensive capabilities.<hex:02100103> <hex:02100103>Speak to the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Expedition Engineer<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for further guidance.

A <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>saddlebag<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> for your chocobo is now available. This spacious sack can be used as a supplement to your normal storage, with features allowing for the simple transfer of items between the saddlebag and your personal and retainer inventories.

Your chocobo companion does not need to be summoned to access the saddlebag, however, it cannot be opened while in an <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>instanced dungeon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, so be sure to move items required on raids to your normal inventory before commencing the duty.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Recorder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is now unlocked, allowing you to document duties for viewing at a later date. Playback features include speed adjustment, focus target switching, and more.

Duty recording is only allowed after several conditions have been met─the first being that the recorder is enabled. Recording can be enabled from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Recorder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> interface located under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu.

The following conditions must be met to use the Duty Recorder:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>　1. Recorder is enabled.<hex:02100103>　2. Current duty is available for recording.<hex:02100103>　3. Parties meet minimum size requirements.<hex:02100103>　4. Record ready check has been executed.
