Recorder settings are enabled<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Recorder settings can be adjusted under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty Recorder<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Duty<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu. When disabled, a recording of the duty will not be taken, even if all other conditions for recording are met.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>2. Current duty is available for recording<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Not all duties are available for recording. Recordable duties are marked with a special icon. This list will change with updates.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>3. Record ready check has been executed<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Approval from all party members is required before recording can begin. Record ready checks are executed under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Party<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu and must be performed within <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>5 minutes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> of commencing a duty.

4. Record ready check has been executed<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Approval from all party members is required before recording can begin. Record ready checks are executed under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Party<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu and must be performed within <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>5 minutes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> of commencing a duty.

Recorded duties can be viewed in <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>inns<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> across the realm. The various playback controls, including <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Group Pose<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Idling Camera<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> functionality, can be confirmed in the Duty Recorder help text.

The <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>message book<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> allows anyone visiting an apartment or estate to leave messages for the home's owner. Conversely, a greeting can be written on the book's first page for all visitors to see.

Consider your message carefully when writing in a message book, as you may only add one entry per day. If necessary, the message can also be removed either by the person who originally penned the entry or the message book's owner.
Entries left in the message book are set to public by default, allowing anyone to view them. However, they can be set to private at the owner's discretion.

Before leaving an estate, you can show your love of the house and its décor by leaving a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>like<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the message book. You are allowed ten likes upon first viewing a message book, and accumulate an additional five likes per day up to a maximum of fifty.
Your companion has placed a great deal of trust in you. So much so, they are willing to allow you to change their attire using glamours.

Gear for the head, body, hands, legs, and feet can be used for glamours so long as it can be equipped by all races and all classes. Please note, however, a glamour prism is required for each piece of gear you wish to glamour.

As a reward for saving them from imminent peril, happy bunnies will help you find hidden treasure on the island.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>They will give you hints as to the location of buried coffers each time you feed them a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>lucky carrot<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
You can offer them as many carrots as you like, but move quickly. Happy bunnies will only accompany you for a limited time for fear of natural predators in the wilds.

When traveling through the portal which can appear after a successful treasure hunt, you may find yourself in a Shifting Sanctum.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Here you will find an <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>arcane sphere<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> which must be used in an unpredictable summoning ritual.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Slay the enemy that appears after performing the rite and a treasure coffer will appear.

The invocation rite can be performed up to five times, triggering one of several arcane runes in a circle around the room.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>This rite typically results in a <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>lesser summon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>greater summon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, or an <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>elder summon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The more powerful the summoning, the greater the rewards.
Should you mistakenly call forth <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Atomos<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, however, you will be forcibly expelled from the altar.
The invocation rite may produce other, unexpected, results, but the only way to be certain is to reach the altars and discover its secrets for yourself.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Mannequins<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are a unique type of furnishing that can be used to not only display gear, but also sell it.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>When placed in an apartment or estate, you will be asked to assign a retainer to manage any gear used for display or to be sold. It is worth noting that no taxes will be collected on gear sold from mannequins.

Gear displayed on a mannequin can be sold separately or as a set. When sold as a set, it must be purchased directly from the mannequin. <hex:02100103><hex:02100103>It is still possible, however, to view sets of gear on the market board using advanced search options. You can then send a message directly to the seller.

Gear sold via mannequins will also be marked with one of two unique icons when viewed on the market board to indicate they are sold separately or as a set.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Use your mannequin's ensembles to draw the eyes of fashion-forward adventurers and customers alike.
You have gained access to the logos manipulator.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>This device utilizes mnemes housed within logograms to grant players logos actions.
Up to three logos actions can be held at any time.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>When enabled, they will be registered as duty actions to be used while adventuring in Eureka.

The logos manipulator can produce a wide variety of actions depending on the type and quantity of logograms used.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Only with trial and error, and perhaps a little luck, can you discover them all.

The functionality of the logos manipulator has been expanded.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The device now houses both an astral and umbral array, each of which can hold up to three logograms. Please note, however, that using a total of four or more logograms will lower the chance of a successful transubstantiation.

While not without risk, successful use of both arrays allows the creation of two actions to be used together during your adventures.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Discover the full potential of mnemes and overcome the dangers of Eureka.

You have obtained a mount that accommodates additional passengers! After forming a party, the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Ride Pillion<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> option will be available when party members select you.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Saddle up and roll out with your friends!

Rather than gaining new actions by increasing in level, blue mages <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>learn them from enemies<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. To acquire an ability, you must witness your foe perform a specific attack before defeating it.

The actions you learn are recorded in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Blue Magic Spellbook<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Spells must be registered as active actions and set to a hotbar before they can be used.
You may register up to 24 spells at once. Checking the box next to a spell will add it to the list of active actions. From there, they can be set to a hotbar.

The blue magic spellbook details the attack type and aspect of each action. You can also view hints on where to acquire spells that you have yet to discover.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>In addition, if you use the Duty Finder to enter duties with level sync or item level sync enabled, the chance of acquiring spells from the corresponding enemies is significantly increased.

By accessing certain aetherytes, it is possible to leave your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Home World<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and visit other World servers in your data center to party with friends, purchase items, and tackle duties.

Be advised that certain restrictions apply when playing on servers other than your Home World.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You can view a list of these restrictions when accessing an aetheryte that allows World Visits.

Unlike most other weapons, blue mage arms generally have little effect on a character's attributes. However, the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Intelligence<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> gained from armor and accessories provides a much larger increase in offensive magic damage compared to other jobs.

The actions you learn are recorded in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Blue Magic Spellbook<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. All actions must be registered before they can be used.

FATEs in certain areas offer <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>bicolor gems<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> as rewards. They can be exchanged with gemstone traders for rare items, some of which can only be obtained via these vendors.
Completing FATEs in these areas with the highest rating possible will increase your rank, which allows the local gemstone trader to offer a wider selection of items.

To view your progress in each applicable area, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Shared FATE<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Travel<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu.

To view your progress in each applicable area, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Shared FATE<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Travel<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu.

Expert recipes demand not only the use of formidable tools, but careful planning and execution of actions.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Unlike most crafted items, those made from expert recipes cannot have a poor or excellent condition. They will instead trigger heretofore unseen conditions with varying effects.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>One must make effective use of these new crafting states to produce items of the highest quality.

When fishing for the choicest of fish, <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Patience<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> can significantly increase the quality of your next catch. However, your chances of reeling in said catch are diminished.

While under the effect of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Patience<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, there are two actions you can use to negate your reduced chance of catching fish─<hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Powerful Hookset<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Precision Hookset<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>These actions are best suited to different types of fish, so you will need to watch your line carefully to determine which to use.

You've gained access to a fashion accessory. To use it, first select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Fashion Accessories<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> from the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The actions to equip accessories can be used directly from this menu, or registered to your hotbar.

After equipping fashion accessories, they can be removed by pressing the action again, or by selecting “Put Away” from the hotbar. (Though who would want to stop flaunting such stylish accoutrements?)<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Fashion accessories may be equipped and removed as many times as you wish.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

You can now craft items using <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Trial Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. Trial synthesis allows you to practice crafting items without using materials, an ideal method for testing high-level recipes.

To begin trial synthesis, open your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>crafting log<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, select the desired recipe, and then press the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Trial Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button to the left of the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Quick Synthesis<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> button. It should be noted that, because you are conducting a trial, no items will be used when crafting. Furthermore, even if your trial synthesis proves successful, you will not receive an item nor will you earn experience points.

You have begun gathering a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>collectable<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─a special type of item highly sought after by certain NPCs. Select the question mark icon at the bottom of the Collectables window to learn more.

When gathering, there is a chance of triggering the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Gatherer's Boon<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> effect, which will grant an additional item during that gathering attempt.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The higher your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>perception<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating, the better chance you have of triggering this effect.

There are certain items that can only be gathered after attaining a sufficient <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>perception<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The requirements for gathering such elusive items can be confirmed at any time via the gathering log.

Your objective when spearfishing is to strike fish with a gig as they pass through teeming waters.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>As they swim across your field of vision, you must strike them in their weak spot, its size increasing according to your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gathering<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> rating.

Nearby fish will take notice of your actions in the teeming waters, their <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>wariness<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> represented by a gauge at the top of the spearfishing interface.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>It increases slowly over time, as well as with each strike with your spear. When the gauge is full, the fish will disperse, ending your spearfishing attempt.

Successfully catching fish in quick succession will increase your <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>catch<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> counter, which slows the rate at which wariness increases.

Thinning the population of certain fish will eventually lure forth rare species, and also grant you the effect of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Spearfisher's Intuition<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
These rare fish, however, will not remain in the area for long, so once you have detected one, focus all your efforts on not letting him be the “one that got away.”

There are certain recipe items that can only be crafted after reaching a sufficient level of <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>quality<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> during synthesis.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The requirements for crafting such items can be confirmed at any time via the crafting log.

When gathering collectables, you may come across <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>prime collectables<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>─items whose composition is in flux.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Prime collectable items that have reached maximum collectability will, on occasion, yield exceedingly rare items from aetherial reduction.

Moreover, these prime collectables may also become <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>sublime collectables<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> when they are gathered with maximum collectability, which guarantees a yield of rare items from aetherial reduction.
A higher gathering rate increases your chances of a prime collectable becoming sublime.

You have learned a <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>gatherer role action<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Gatherer role actions are abilities shared by botanists, miners, and fishers rather than a specific class. They are learned via leveling or upon completing certain quests, but only need to be learned once to be able to use them with all gathering classes.
Once learned, these role actions can be used to reveal and track gathering locations in any given area, even for classes other than your currently selected one.

Gatherer role actions can be found in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> window, found under <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>main menu<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>.
Please note that glamours for summoner require completion of the quest “An Egi by Any Other Name,” while glamours for scholar require completion of the quest “A Faerie Tale Come True.”
You have unlocked <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Facewear<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>These purely decorative accessories can be worn in addition to headgear.

Review your collection by selecting Character from the main menu followed by <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Facewear<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>. From this window, you can choose different styles and colors and devise the perfect look for your character.

The <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>scenario guide<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> is a HUD element that indicates the next available quest in the main scenario. It also displays the next available quest for your currently equipped job or class.
By selecting the <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>scenario guide<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, you can confirm where these quests are located on the map.

Recipes under the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Special Recipes<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> category of the crafting log are used primarily to craft items required when progressing through certain quests and duties.

Among these recipes are items that are not recorded in the crafting log, and will therefore not grant an experience points bonus when crafted for the first time.<hex:02100103>The crafting log's filter settings can be used to view only those recipes that will be recorded when crafted.
Be advised, however, these recipes are more complex than others of a comparable level, with higher requirements to craft. Practice and planning is highly recommended before challenging these recipes.
